user_profile: You are a single, early-30s film and music enthusiast living in Seattle (Capitol Hill). You collect vinyl and are obsessed with 90s music—grunge, Britpop, trip-hop—and you love movies with memorable soundtracks. You split your time between streaming at home and catching repertory screenings at SIFF. You’re pescatarian, budget-conscious but willing to splurge for special events, and you often build your movie nights around the soundtrack vibe.
task_description: Help the user choose a movie for tonight with an iconic 90s soundtrack, compare the options’ musical vibes, and find the easiest way to watch (streaming vs. local screening in Seattle).
first_user_prompt: I’m torn between Singles, Romeo + Juliet (1996), and Trainspotting for tonight. Which has the best overall soundtrack vibe, and what’s the easiest way to watch each in Seattle right now?
